page.title: 01SEVERN VALE EAST OF MALVERNS
page.content: Part of a prosperous valley of the River Severn lying south of the small but ancient town of Upton-Upon-Severn. New building technicques have allowed residential buildings on land previously subjected to flooding. Apart from the established farmers who mostly have milking herds, the varied working population go to their places of employment mainly by private car in various towns such as Worcester, Pershore, Gloucester, Tewkesbury, Cheltenham and Malvern, which radiate like spokes in a wheel. The beauty and tranquility of the area attracts holidaymaking to the river and countryside. The advantages of the Malvern Hills lying some eight miles away are fully appreciated. Many professional people have contributed to a recognition of its qualities by retiring to the district.
